questions.question_text:
HOTSPOT -
Your company has an Azure Container Registry named Registry1.
You have an Azure virtual machine named Server1 that runs Windows Server 2019.
From Server1, you create a container image named image1 and then tag image1.
You need to add image1 to Registry1.
Which command should you run on Server1? To answer, select the appropriate options in the answer area.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.
Hot Area:
//IMG//

questions.answer_description:
An Azure container registry stores and manages private Docker container images, similar to the way Docker Hub stores public Docker images. You can use the
Docker command-line interface (Docker CLI) for login, push, pull, and other operations on your container registry.
Reference:
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/container-registry/container-registry-get-started-docker-cli https://docs.docker.com/engine/reference/commandline/push/

Box 1: Zone-redundant storage (ZRS)
Zone-redundant storage (ZRS) replicates your data synchronously across three storage clusters in a single region.
LRS would not remain available if a data center in the region fails
GRS and RA GRS use asynchronous replication.
Box 2: StorageV2 (general purpose V2)
ZRS only support GPv2.
Reference:
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/storage/common/storage-redundancy https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/storage/common/storage-redundancy-zrs

Passed the exam. There was a new case study that is not yet listed in this website. However, the questions from this site is sufficient to pass.

Q1:
LRS: 3 copies in one data center
ZRS: 3 copies across 3 data centers in one region
GRS/RAGRS: 3 copies in one data center, another 3 copies in another datacenter in another region
GZRS/RAGZRS: 3 copies across 3 data centers in one region, another 3 copies across 3 data centers in another region

cross region copy is async.

Q2:
bolb is not account type
only V2 support ZRS

The answer is ZRS & Storage V2
Given Answer is Correct
26-June-21, Passed the exam. ZRS and Storage V2
The answer is ZRS & Storage V2.
Was in today's exam. Answer is ZRS and V2
it shoud be GRS and StorageV2. in the question they are referring to region not zone

comments.content: incorrect, rdiaz has a point. GRS is async. True, you can have geo-redundant sync but then it’s GZRS, which is not an option in the question.
the trick are on the question: Remains available if a "single data center" in the region fails. so that means that is a zone of the region

GRS replicates data asynchronously.
So, answer is ZRS and V2.
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/storage/common/storage-redundancy

discussion.content: correct answer, Was in today exam

How should you configure the storage account? To answer, select the appropriate options in the answer area.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.
Hot Area:
//IMG//

discussion.content: Question appeared On AZ-303 exam on 08/12/2021 - 49 questions, 4Q - Fabrikan case study

Answer is correct
Request header and Base64
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/app-service/app-service-web-configure-tls-mutual-auth

https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/app-service/app-service-web-configure-tls-mutual-auth

In App Service, TLS termination of the request happens at the frontend load balancer. When forwarding the request to your app code with client certificates enabled, App Service injects an X-ARR-ClientCert request header with the client certificate. App Service does not do anything with this client certificate other than forwarding it to your app. Your app code is responsible for validating the client certificate .

You can get the certificate from Request.Headers and decode from Base64.

Answer is correct
This que is also there in 203 and 204

discussion.content: Was in today's exam. Answer is Contributor, VM Mach Contri, Storage acc cont for last 2
In the exam on 12-03-2022. Total 50 questions including case study. "Litware Acquired Fabricam" case study.
On exam today 19/11/21. Correct answer. Score 860.
Contributor, VM Machine Contributor, Storage account Contributor (x2)

Given answer is correct

Contributor - Can create and manage all types of Azure resources but can't grant access to others.

VM operators must be able to manage VMs, but not the virtual network or storage account to which they are connected -> VM Contributor

Developers and contractors must be able to manage storage accounts -> storage account contributor
Was on exam 3 July 2021 and correct
Was in today's exam and the given answers are correct.

"Project managers must be able to manage everything except access and authentication for users"..This statement is wrong for Contributor Right..The role of Contributor is To provide the access to others but in the question mentioned specially as EXCEPT Key word..Could any one please correct, Does my understanding is right.. I think For the PM The role to be provided as Reader.

comments.content: "Reader" can't be the right for for PM as it is readonly, but they are supposed to "MANAGE everything except access". Contributor is exactly what they need.

Google is your friend: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/role-based-access-control/built-in-roles
Contributor role: Grants full access to manage all resources, but does not allow you to assign roles in Azure RBAC, manage assignments in Azure Blueprints, or share image galleries.

discussion.content: correct and came in exam last week

questions.question_text:
DRAG DROP -
You are designing a solution to secure a company's Azure resources. The environment hosts 10 teams. Each team manages a project and has a project manager, a virtual machine (VM) operator, developers, and contractors.
Project managers must be able to manage everything except access and authentication for users. VM operators must be able to manage VMs, but not the virtual network or storage account to which they are connected. Developers and contractors must be able to manage storage accounts.
You need to recommend roles for each member.
What should you recommend? To answer, drag the appropriate roles to the correct employee types. Each role may be used once, more than once, or not at all.
You may need to drag the split bar between panes or scroll to view content.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.
Select and Place:
//IMG//

You have an Azure virtual machine named VM1 and an Azure Active Directory (Azure AD) tenant named adatum.com.
VM1 has the following settings:
✑ IP address: 10.10.0.10
✑ System-assigned managed identity: On
You need to create a script that will run from within VM1 to retrieve the authentication token of VM1.
Which address should you use in the script?

discussion.content:
In today's exam. Score 900+ 
Correct answer.
Correct answer, this is the magical IP in the cloud world !

This was on today's exam. 12/29/2021
Gave same answer
On exam 23 Dec 2021, I chose the same answer
Question appeared On AZ-303 exam on 08/12/2021 - 49 questions, 4Q - Fabrikan case study

https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/virtual-machines/windows/instance-metadata-service?tabs=windows

You'll find the IP 169.254.169.254 mentioned lots of times so answer is B

On Exam yesterday 08/14/2021 - Correct Answer
I passed
9th Aug 21 - Was in today's exam. 54 Questions in total (4 Case study), No Lab

IMDS is a REST API that's available at a well-known, non-routable IP address (169.254.169.254). You can only access it from within the VM. Communication between the VM and IMDS never leaves the host. Have your HTTP clients bypass web proxies within the VM when querying IMDS, and treat 169.254.169.254 the same as 168.63.129.16.
Took exam today passed this morning was on there 6/21/2021
Was in today's exam and the given answers are correct.

"IMDS is a REST API that's available at a well-known, non-routable IP address (169.254.169.254). You can only access it from within the VM"
From <https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/virtual-machines/windows/instance-metadata-service?tabs=windows>

questions.answer_description:
Your code that's running on the VM can request a token from the Azure Instance Metadata Service identity endpoint, accessible only from within the VM: http://169.254.169.254/metadata/identity/oauth2/token
Reference:
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/active-directory/managed-identities-azure-resources/overview
